creator: hubertus@groepper.com
text:
Using Firefox on OSX, lenya 1.2.1 from svn as of 09/12/04, and tomcat 5.0 under
debian.

When uploading an asset to a page, one needs to assign a title for that asset.
Special chars like German Umlaute in that title field are beeing replaced by the
? sign in the generel asset overview. Encoding seems to be UTF8.

creator: gregor@apache.org
text:
i just tried this, svn of today, in jetty. no problems. can you still reproduce
this?

creator: hubertus@groepper.com
text:
Yes, no changes. Using jetty as well, firefox in osx, svn 126608.

Steps:
Edit page (default pub) with bxe
Add image
Add Umlaute to the title field
Submit
--> Umlaute in the title are beeing replaced with a question mark in the object library below the form 
for adding images.

Also, when you actually insert an image, the title field in the "edit object attributes" dialogue in BXE is 
empty. Is the title not passed on to BXE?

can you check if your form-encoding in web.xml is set to utf-8? there was a bug
with web.xml that has been fixed today.
creator: gregor@apache.org

text:
I have 
<!--Patched by Lenya build process-->
<init-param>
<param-name>form-encoding</param-name>
<param-value>UTF-8</param-value>
</init-param>
in /opt/tomcat/webapps/lenya/WEB-INF

SVN is 149457, Firefox on OSX. Same with Jetty.
Also, when you enter multiple umlaute, say öäü, the result is still a singe ? (in the source as well).
creator: hubertus@groepper.com

text: Same for both Tomcat 5.0.28 and Jetty on Windows XP (using Firefox 1 on Win).
creator: hubertus@groepper.com
felix.roethenbacher@wyona.com
text:
This bug is related to: http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=33013
Patching the CocoonServlet class as proposed fixes this bug.

creator: agallardo@agsoftware.dnsalias.com
text:
(In reply to comment #7)
> This bug is related to: http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=33013
> Patching the CocoonServlet class as proposed fixes this bug.

Cocoon now uses a new bug tracking system. Referred bugzilla #33013 is already
fixed since cocoon 2.1.7. See:

http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/COCOON-1402

(In reply to comment #8 and comment #10)
> Works for 1.4 rev 413939.


Think so. I'm closing this.
creator: hubertus@groepper.com
